qas.question: What is the purpose of testing software?
Why is it so difficult to locate bugs in software?

answers.text: tests for even simple software components is practically infinite

qas.question: What can come from one bug being fixed?

answers.text: it can illuminate other, deeper bugs,

qas.question: What is the number of tests for complex software components?

plausible_answers.text: to select tests that are feasible for the available time and resources.

qas.question: Firmware testing uses strategy to accomplish what?

plausible_answers.text: finding software bugs (errors or other defects)

qas.question: software testing attempts to eliminate a program for what reason?
The job of testing is called what type of progress?

plausible_answers.text: it can illuminate other, deeper bugs, or can even create new ones.

qas.question: What are some complications of not fixing bugs?

context: As the number of possible <a1_0>tests for even simple software components is <b3_0>practically infinite<b3_0/><a1_0/>, all software testing uses some strategy <b4_0>to select tests that are feasible for the available time and resources.<b4_0/> As a result, software testing typically (but not exclusively) attempts to execute a program or application with the intent of <a0_0><b5_0>finding software bugs<a0_0/> (errors or other defects)<b5_0/>. The job of testing is an <b6_0>iterative<b6_0/> process as when one bug is fixed, <a2_0><b7_0>it can illuminate other, deeper bugs,<a2_0/> or can even create new ones.
